title: Co-Büchi automaton
summary: In automata theory, a co-Büchi automaton is a variant of Büchi automaton. The only difference is the accepting condition: a Co-Büchi automaton accepts an infinite word w {\displaystyle w} if there exists a run, such that all the states occurring infinitely often in the run are in the final state set F {\displaystyle F} . In contrast, a Büchi automaton accepts a word w {\displaystyle w} if there exists a run, such that at least one state occurring infinitely often in the final state set F {\displaystyle F} .
